Member Function Documentation

void FunkOS_Task::CreateTask ( BYTE *  pcName_,
UCHAR  ucPriority_ 
)

Add a task from the scheduler list.

This function populates a given task structure with the parameters given. The stack is then initialized, and the task is set as stopped, and all state variables and timeouts reset. Once the task is created, it must be added using the scheduler's Add() function, and started using Start()

Parameters:
pcName_ - pointer to the task name
ucPriority_ - priority of the task (0-255)
Returns:
(BOOL) TRUE on success, FAIL on failure

void FunkOS_Task::SetQuantum ( USHORT  usTicks_  ) 

Set the time between context switches when multiple tasks are executing at the same priority level

Parameters:
usTicks_ - the number of ticks inbetween switching
void FunkOS_Task::SetState ( TASK_STATE  eState_  ) 
void FunkOS_Task::Sleep ( USHORT  usTime_  ) 

Set a task to sleep for a period of time specified in the arguments

Parameters:
usTime_ - the time period in RTOS ticks to sleep through
void FunkOS_Task::Start ( void   ) 

Set a task as ready to run

void FunkOS_Task::Stop ( void   ) 

Stop a task from running, but does not remove it from the scheduler if it is already connected.

void FunkOS_Task::Yield ( void   )  [static]

Trigger a software interrupt that will invoke the context switch. This is the best mechanism for triggering a context switch from an application or system-service level, as it is completely thread-safe and can be invoked from an interrupt.

WORD* FunkOS_Task::m_pwTopStack

Pointer to current stack top.

This is the basic task control block in the RTOS. It contains parameters and state information required for a task, including stack, priority, timeouts, entry funcitons, and task pending semaphore.
